subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Batteries!
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-1309235368-1167795975=:99195
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Like all fuzzy kids should be =)
   
  Ive been studying antennas, parabolic, biquad, and cantennas in general. I just realized that one of the first things I "built" was a cantenna like reciever for my mic. I didnt have a clue at the time thats what I was doing LOL and its only to enhance the sound quality even tho I have it directed at the wall.
   
  Thats the thing about the voices with building, I just dont get it. Like Otto said I am not scientific enough LOL. But I did it and it worked and now that I stumbled onto the other stuff I just may go back and redo it the right way. Mines just made outta tin foil, pretty lame I know but tin foil or not it does help.
   
  Misty

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
  Thanks, and naw, I can't get that dog to do a thing! Spoiled rotten.


>From: Misty Dawn 
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Batteries!
>Date: Thu, 28 Dec 2006 22:19:19 -0800 (PST)
>
>I like your little helper. What a cutie!
>
> Is that working better now?
>
> Misty
>
>Frank Sumption wrote:
> Hi All;
>
>I'm having instability problems that I think is caused by batteries, so I
>went to Batteries Plus yesterday and got the smallest 12 volt gel cells 
>they
>had. I didn't want to charge the batteries connected a plus and minus
>supply, the plus side draws more current with the audio functions, so needs
>more charge current. I also didn't have the chips on hand to make a plus 
>and
>minus adjustable supply for the charger. I came up with the switch shown to
>seperate the batteries for charging, or connect them in a plus and minus
>supply configuration to run the boards.
>
>Frank
>
